Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially greyish in section, the interior is thickly encrusted with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink with two parallel lines of cord-marked decoration around the shoulder.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394473) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394473)
